V.iii.11.2.d
.
Cardiovascular Complications of Diabetes Mellitus
Diabetic cardiovascular complications include, but are not limited to
hypertension
atherosclerosis (used interchangeably with arteriosclerotic heart disease (coronary artery disease))
peripheral arterial disease
peripheral vascular disease
cardiomyopathy
congestive heart failure, and
stroke (macrovascular complication).
References
:  For more information on
cardiovascular complications, see
M21-1, Part V, Subpart iii, 5
, and
38 CFR 4.104
, and
macrovascular complications to include stroke, see
38 CFR 4.124(a)
.
title: M21-1, Part V, Subpart iii, Chapter 11 - Endocrine Conditions
citation: Part V, Subpart iii, Chapter 11, Section None
